alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 10:47PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Clark and southern Scotland Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1047 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Greensburg, or 12 miles southwest of Memphis, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kahoka, Memphis, Warsaw, Wayland, Wyaconda, Alexandria, Rutledge, Luray, South Gorin, St. Francisville, Greensburg, Winchester, Gregory Landing, Clark County Fairgrounds, Ashton, Fairmont, Medill, St. Patrick, Etna and Sand Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern Missouri.
